Since t can be up to some value, but in Fortran, we can use allocatable arrays. So code outline:

program main
    implicit none
    integer :: v1, v2, t, d
    integer(8) :: ans
    integer(8), allocatable :: dp(:,:)
    character(len=20) ::
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
str_ans
    integer :: i, j, x, len_ans

    !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Allocate dp array
    allocate(dp(0:t-2, 0:1149))

    ! Initialize dp to -1e17
    dp = -10000000000000000  ! -1e17

    ! Set initial condition
    dp(0, v1) = v1

    ! Fill dp do i = 1, t-2
        do j = 0, 1149
            ! First loop for x from 0 to d
            do x = 0, d
                if (j + x <= 1149) then
                    if (dp(i,j) < dp(i-1,j+x) + j) then
                        dp(i,j) = dp(i-1,j+x) + j
                    end if
                end if
            end do
            ! Second loop for x from d down to 0
            do x = d, 0, -1 if (j - x >= 0) then
                    if (dp(i,j) < dp(i-1,j -x) + j) then
                        dp(i,j) = dp(i-1,j -x) + j
                    end if
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end do

    ! Compute ans
    ans = -10000000000000000  ! Initialize to -infinity
    do j = 0, 1149
        if (abs(j - v2) <= d) then
            if (ans < dp(t-2,j) + v2) then
                ans = dp(t-2,j) +
children.label: code_analysis

v2
            end if
        end if
    end do

    ! Convert ans to string and replace commas
    write(str_ans, '(I0)') ans
    len_ans = len_trim(str_ans) do i = 1, len_ans
        if (str_ans(i:i) == ',') then
            str_ans(i:i) = ' '
        end if
    end do

    !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Output the result
    print '(A)', trim(str_ans)

    !
children.label: mental_execution

children.text:
Deallocate dp
    deallocate(dp)

end program main

Putting it all together:

The Fortran program will:

1. Read v1, v2, t, d from input.

2. Allocate the dp array.

3. Initialize dp.

4. Fill dp according to the loops.

5. Compute ans.

6. Convert ans to a string, replace commas with spaces.

7. Output the string.

Now, handling the dynamic allocation of the dp array. Since t can be up to some value, but in Fortran, we can use allocatable arrays.

So code outline:

program main
    implicit none
    integer :: v1, v2, t, d
    integer(8) :: ans
    integer(8), allocatable :: dp(:,:)
    character(len=20) :: str_ans
    integer :: i, j, x, len_ans

    ! Read input
    read*, v1, v2, t, d

    ! Allocate dp array
    allocate(dp(0:t-2, 0:1149))

    ! Initialize dp to -1e17
    dp = -10000000000000000  ! -1e17

    ! Set initial condition
    dp(0, v1) = v1

    ! Fill dp
    do i = 1, t-2
        do j = 0, 1149
            ! First loop for x from 0 to d
            do x = 0, d
                if (j + x <= 1149) then
                    if (dp(i,j) < dp(i-1,j+x) + j) then
                        dp(i,j) = dp(i-1,j+x) + j
                    end if
                end if
            end do
            ! Second loop for x from d down to 0
            do x = d, 0, -1
                if (j - x >= 0) then
                    if (dp(i,j) < dp(i-1,j -x) + j) then
                        dp(i,j) = dp(i-1,j -x) + j
                    end if
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end do

    ! Compute ans
    ans = -10000000000000000  ! Initialize to -infinity
    do j = 0, 1149
        if (abs(j - v2) <= d) then
            if (ans < dp(t-2,j) + v2) then
                ans = dp(t-2,j) + v2
            end if
        end if
    end do

    ! Convert ans to string and replace commas
    write(str_ans, '(I0)') ans
    len_ans = len_trim(str_ans)
    do i = 1, len_ans
        if (str_ans(i:i) == ',') then
            str_ans(i:i) = ' '
        end if
    end do

    ! Output the result
    print '(A)', trim(str_ans)

    ! Deallocate dp
    deallocate(dp)

end program main
